reference_summary:
The Lord Peter Wimsey Mysteries: Set 2 Ian Carmichael (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Mystery & Suspense ['Ian Carmichael stars in the original British adaptations', '"Eternally appealing" --NPR’s Fresh Air', 'As seen on Masterpiece Theatre', '"Realized superbly" --', 'The New York Times', '"The cast is splendid" --', 'The Washington Post', 'IAN CARMICHAEL STARS in the original BBC adaptations of the Dorothy L. Sayers crime thrillers. Hailed by critics as one of the finest mystery series ever filmed, its success on PBS’s Masterpiece Theatre inspired the spin-off Mystery! Running at least three hours each, these dramas do full justice to Sayers’s vivid characters, trenchant wit, and lavish 1920s settings.', 'THE MYSTERIES:', 'MURDER MUST ADVERTISE Lord Peter goes deep undercover at Pym’s Publicity to investigate the suspicious death of a young copywriter following his affair with a wealthy and indolent socialite.', 'FIVE RED HERRINGS When the body of an unpopular artist is found in a stream, it’s up to Lord Peter to determine which of six suspects could have committed the crime.', 'THE NINE TAILORS Stranded in a sleepy village after a car accident, Lord Peter quickly stumbles upon a decades-old case of stolen emeralds, unidentifiable corpses, and coded messages.'] {'Genre': 'Mystery & Suspense/British Mystery Theater, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Ian Carmichael', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '8435', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '10 hours and 4 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 28, 2010', 'Actors': 'Ian Carmichael', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '3'} it arrived early and packaged well. played well and was very enjoyable. Five Stars {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alex Gabassi'], 'Producers': ['Mammoth Screen LTD', 'Agatha Christie Productions LTD', 'Farah Abushwesha'], 'Starring': ['John Malkovich', 'Rupert Grint', 'Andrew Buchan']} I love this adaption! I've never been a fan of the David Suchet "Poirot". his character came across as prissy and more of a caricature than anything else. so to see the Poirot that Malkovich portrayed was such a treat, he brought depth to the character that was sadly lacking before.
I would highly recommend this to anyone even if they're not Agatha Christie fans. ABC murders WWII In HD: Collector’s Edition Rob Lowe (Actor), Justin Bartha (Actor), Frederic Lumiere (Director), Matthew Ginsburg (Director) & 1 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Documentary ['Product Description', 'Seventy years in the making. Three thousand hours of color footage few knew existed. The first documentary to show original color footage of World War II in immersive HD, the world premiere HISTORYTM series WWII IN HD uses the journals and accounts of those who served in the war s biggest battles to create a personal, introspective and detailed look at life on and off the front lines. This lavish gift set includes the original HISTORY series plus two specials: THE AIR WAR and IWO JIMA.'] {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': 'unknown', 'Director': 'Frederic Lumiere, Matthew Ginsburg', 'Media Format': "Box set, NTSC, Collector's Edition", 'Run time': '7 hours and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 15, 2012', 'Actors': 'Rob Lowe, Justin Bartha', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Number of discs': '5'} this was a gift and the recipient said it was really good, accurate, entertaining. DVD Murder, She Wrote: The Complete Series [DVD] Angela Lansbury (Actor), Tom Bosley (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Mystery & Suspense ['Winner of four Golden Globes and nominated for 12 consecutive Emmy awards for Best Actress in a Drama, Angela Lansbury stars as the unforgettable Jessica Fletcher in the legendary murder mystery series Murder, She Wrote. Quick to outwit both criminals and cops when it comes to solving a murder, Jessica uses her considerable intellect, charm, and persistence to get to the bottom of every crime she encounters. For the first time ever, all 12 seasons are available on 63 discs in one complete collection. Featuring a sensational array of guest stars, including George Clooney, Shirley Jones, Courtney Cox, Leslie Nielson, Joaquin Phoenix, Mickey Rooney, and many more, Murder, She Wrote, the two-time Primetime Emmy and Golden Globe winner, is a must-own DVD set that will arrest your attention for all 264 thrilling episodes.Bonus Content:', 'Murder, She Wrote: Season Three:', "The Great '80s TV Flashback", "The Great '80s TV Flashback", 'Bonus Episode - Magnum, P.I.: Season 7\xa0- Novel Connection', 'Bonus Episode - Magnum, P.I.: Season 7\xa0- Novel Connection', 'Murder, She Wrote: Season Four:', 'Bonus Episode: Murder, She Wrote "Snow White, Blood Red"', 'Bonus Episode: Murder, She Wrote "Snow White, Blood Red"', 'Murder, She Wrote: Season Five:', 'Origin of a Series', 'Origin of a Series', 'Murder, She Wrote: Season Six:', 'Recipe for a Hit', 'Recipe for a Hit', "America's Top Sleuths", "America's Top Sleuths", 'Murder, She Wrote: Season Seven:', 'The Perils of Success', 'The Perils of Success', 'Murder, She Wrote: Season Ten:', 'Bonus Episode - Amsterdam Kill', 'Bonus Episode - Amsterdam Kill', 'Murder, She Wrote: Season Eleven:', 'Bonus Episode - Big Easy Murder', 'Bonus Episode - Big Easy Murder', 'Bonus Episode - Home Care', 'Bonus Episode - Home Care'] {'Genre': 'Drama, Television, DVD Movie, Blu-ray Movie, Mystery & Suspense', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'William Windom, Tom Bosley, Ron Masak, Angela Lansbury', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Number Of Discs': '63', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '5.4 x 7.7 x 7.2 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '212 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 1, 2013', 'Actors': 'Angela Lansbury, Tom Bosley, Ron Masak, William Windom', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '63'} if you love the series, you won't be disappointed in this set. great {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['H.C. profile:
**Updated User Summary:**

- **Genres of Interest:** The user remains committed to mystery and suspense, with a particular fondness for British adaptations and innovative reimaginings of classic stories. Their enthusiasm for high-quality historical documentaries continues, reinforcing their preference for authentic narratives.

- **Format Preference:** The user consistently favors boxed sets, indicating a desire for extensive collections that explore thematic depth in both narrative-driven series and documentaries.

- **Quality Appreciation:** Following a recent critique that highlighted intense dissatisfaction with content quality, the user has become more assertive in their expectations for excellence. They have a low tolerance for narratives that lack execution, reflecting a shift towards demanding higher standards from their selections.

- **Key Features:** Intricately woven storytelling and rich character development are paramount. The user favors documentaries that provide profound insights into historical events, especially those accentuated by personal narratives.

- **Overall Sentiment:** Despite previous negative feedback, the user generally maintains a positive outlook regarding their choices and expresses enthusiasm for curated offerings. Their latest interaction, which highlighted a well-executed film that kept them guessing, suggests they still find enjoyment in quality content, blending their expectations for innovation with appreciation for engaging storytelling. This evolving engagement reflects their readiness to critique and celebrate exceptional narratives across diverse genres.
